conclusion: To determine if the particle has returned to its starting point, analyze the area under the v-t graph.
From t = 0 to t = 1 second, the velocity is constant at 2 m/s.
From t = 1 to t = 3 seconds, the velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to -2 m/s.
Displacement for Segment 1 (t = 0 to t = 1 second) is 2 m.
Velocity changes linearly from 2 m/s to -2 m/s forms a triangle with the time axis.
Area of the triangle for Segment 2 (t = 1 to t = 3 seconds) is 4 m.
The particle has not returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark.
